description.narrative: In the Binga region of Zimbabwe, women face marginalization and exclusion, imbalances that are further exacerbated by recent political, food, fuel and financial crises. This programme seeks to contribute to rural women's economic empowerment in Binga by supporting their greater access to and utilization of natural resources in environmentally sustainable way, increasing their knowledge of biodiversity and sustainability and advocating for gender mainstreaming. The programme will reach out to women fishers, entrepreneurs, craft producers and fish traders in three wards, increasing their access to and capacity for sustainable fish farming (tilapia breams), kapenta fishing and exploitation of forest products such as baobab, jatropha, moringa and establishing ecotourism facilities. Moreover, the programme will support women's ability to develop better producer-market linkages and increase their knowledge of economic policies, resulting in higher incomes for rural women. As economically empowered women, they will then be better placed to tackle gender inequality issues in the public and private realms and resist abuse
